department.en: Graduate Institute of Network Learning Technology

goal.ch: 教學目標：本課程目的在透過專家學者之研究分享、針對議題的文獻閱讀、撰寫反思心得報告時，透過課堂討論與小組合作進行學習內化與深化，擴展學生在數位學習科技領域之相關知識，並瞭解各領域學術研究的進行方法，以及該領域之研究現況。
goal.en: Teaching Objectives: The purpose of this course is to expand students‘ knowledge in the field of digital learning technology through the sharing of research by experts and scholars, literature reading on relevant topics, and writing reflection reports. By engaging in classroom discussions and group collaboration, students will internalize and deepen their learning. Additionally, they will gain an understanding of the research methodologies used in various fields and the current state of research in those areas.

outline.ch: 課程大綱：課程第一階段在於介紹數位科技應用範疇；第二階段帶領學生針對數位學習科技應用的研究議題進行研究方法的探討；第三階段邀請產業與學界前輩來跟學生作經驗交流。
outline.en:
Course Outline: First Phase: Introduction to the scope of digital technology applications.
Second Phase: Guiding students in exploring research methodologies for studying issues related to the application of digital learning technology. Third Phase: Inviting industry and academic experts to share their experiences with the students.

gradMethod.ch:
1.課堂參與程度 (10％)：上課狀況，包括：出席情況、課堂發問、參與討論與提問、線上同儕回饋。課程若無法出席，請與老師及助教請假。
2.課程反思報告 (40％)：撰寫個人心得報告，每人至少繳交8次。報告內容包括：課堂摘要、延伸閱讀、課堂反思。需於每週四課程結束後至該週日午夜前上傳平台。
3.小組專題口頭報告 (25％)：在課堂中進行口頭報告，每組報告(含討論)約30分鐘。專題報告內容包括：科技專題、活動議題、學習理論、研究方法等四面向。同學於平台上進行同儕回饋。
4.小組專題書面報告 (25％)：第18週學期結束前繳交小組專題報告書，並註記個人參與面向說明。
gradMethod.en:
1. Class Participation (10％): Class performance, including attendance, classroom questioning, participation in discussions and inquiries, and online peer feedback. If you are unable to attend class, please inform the instructor and teaching assistant for leave of absence.

2. Course Reflection Reports (40％): Write personal reflection reports, with each student required to submit at least 8 reports. The report content should include: class summary, extended reading, and class reflections. Reports need to be uploaded to the platform by midnight on the Sunday following each week‘s Thursday class.

3. Group Project Oral Presentation (25％): Oral presentations will be conducted in class with each group presenting (including discussion) for about 30 minutes. The project report content should cover four aspects: technology topics, activity issues, learning theories, and research methods. Students will provide peer feedback on the platform.

4. Group Project Written Report (25％): Submit the group project report by the end of the 18th week, marking the end of the semester. The report should include an explanation of each member‘s contributions.

flexDiscription.ch: 碩博課程，以專題之深究與研討為主；後兩週針對專題口頭報告的回饋進行修改，以及書面報告的撰寫。提升學生對於課程內容的內化、反思與產出。
flexDiscription.en: Graduate courses focus on in-depth exploration and discussion of specialized topics. In the final two weeks, students will revise their oral presentations based on feedback and work on writing their written reports. This approach aims to enhance students' internalization, reflection, and output related to the course content.

en.competencies: Understand the developing history and trend of network learning.
Develop the theoretical accomplishment of network learning.
Develop the needed technological ability of network learning.
Develop the research methodology of network learning and the ability to  promote and put network learning in use.
Develop the ability to coordinate and make innovative design.
Develop multi-disciplined  talents with international perspective.
